intro: Franciscea grandiflora, commonly known as the grandiflora franciscea, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant features hairy stems and leaves that are usually opposite in arrangement. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or open habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is relatively rare in the wild.
